oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Card catalog : finding books the old way
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two students consult the old card catalog in the Todd Library.
Maintenance of the card catalog was discontinued when the library implemented an online catalog in the 1980s, and the card catalog was discarded when the Library moved to its new building in 1999.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait of Isa Lee (Sherrod) Freeman, who served as a librarian at Middle Tennessee State Teacher's College from 1935 to 1940. She was the first professional librarian hired by the College and taught library science courses in addition to serving as a librarian

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Faculty and administration photographic directory, Fall 1986
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Middle Tennessee State University, Photographic Services; Middle Tennessee State University, Publications and Graphics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A directory of university faculty and administrator portraits for the fall semester of the 1986-87 school year. Diamond/ 75th anniversary issue

Middle Tennessee State University Faculty and Administration Middle Tennessee State Normal School Faculty and Students 1911 PHOTOGRAPHIC DIRECTORY FALL 1986 ~ Diamond Anniversary + 1911- 1986 As part of the celebration of our 75th anniversary, this directory of faculty members and administrative personnel is provided by Photographic Services and Publications and Graphics with funds from the Office of Vice President for Academic Affairs and with the support and encouragement of the 1985- 86 Faculty Senate. Extensive efforts were made to obtain up- to- date photographs and to be accurate in the listings. Much appreciation goes to faculty members and administrators who graciously responded and cooperated. The personnel included reflect the best information available in late summer; however, changes occurring after that time will not be reflected. Plans are to produce an addendum of the new faculty members and administrative staff each fall. The inclusion of telephone and box numbers was requested by 1985- 86 Faculty Senate President Earl Hinton as a convenience for users. Publications and Graphics regrets any changes or inaccuracies which may have occurred in that information. Photographs are by Jack Ross and Mark Hay of Photographic Services. Compilation of information was coordinated by Diane Stewart; type and page design and layout were done by Mitzi Brandon; cover design was by Judy Hall, all of Publications and Graphics under the direction of Suma Clark. The directory was printed at the Print Shop, Tony Snook, director. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Directory of administrators and faculty at the University in the fall semester of the 1980-81 school year

Middle Tennessee State University This directory of faculty members and administrative personnel is provided by University Publications. a part of the Office of Public Relations. Photographs are by University Photographer Jack Ross and Pat Casey Daley. Layout and design work was done by student Bill Ray under the direction of Suma Clark, Publications Coordinator. Special thanks for their help and cooperation go to Bob Arnette. Director of Personnel, and toJim Booth, Director of University Print Shop. Extensive efforts were made to obtain up- to- date photographs and to be accurate in the listings. Much appreciation goes to those who aided and cooperated. Some changes in personnel which occurred during the last stages of production may not be reflected in the

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Todd Library acquires Gutenberg Bible facsimile as 500,000th volume
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Howze, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reports on the acquisition of a facsimile Gutenberg Bible as the 500,000th volume in Todd Library and invites the public to a celebration on April 12, 1987. Includes historical background on the Bible and notes the observation of 1987 as Year of the Reader
Holley, Edward G.; Craig, J. Donald

The Faculty and Staff of Todd Library cordially invite you to attend an open house celebrating the addition ofthe 500,OOOth volume, a facsimile ofthe Gutenberg Bible Sunday, April 12, 1987 from two o'clock to four o'clock at Todd Library . Middle Tennessee State University.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The First Fifty Years: A History of MTSC
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pittard, Homer
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Hinton, Nora Smith, illustrator; Smotherman, Bealer, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A history of the Middle Tennessee State College from its founding in 1911 as the Middle Tennessee State Normal School to 1961. Describes the political environment that led to its creation, early organization and administration, students and student activities, faculty and staff, campus planning and construction, etc. Also includes references to the history of the model school that later became the Homer Pittard Campus School

Introduction -- Conception -- Birth -- Staffing the school -- Early Normal years -- Growth and transition -- New status : teachers college -- Troubled years -- New status : state college -- Post war expansion -- At the half century and beyond -- Acknowledgements -- Appendices -- Index.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Raider Forties
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Raider Forties recounts the experiences of a group of young men who attended Middle Tennessee State College prior to World War II--ten of whom left to serve in the military. It traces the lives of those who returned and commemorates those who did not. Many professors and other campus personalities are discussed as well
Part 1. The forty frosh -- The year two -- Summer of '42 -- The Fall of '42 -- Departure -- Rehearsal -- Where did all the flowers go? -- Return -- Part 2. Taps.
